intro: Assonia repanda, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its palmate leaves with a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Assonia repanda is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
